verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,
verses.ct: Then the LORD continued speaking to Job:

verses.kjv: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.
verses.ct: "Will the one who argues with the Almighty try to correct him? Let the person who challenges God give an answer."

verses.kjv: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
verses.ct: Job replied to the LORD:

verses.kjv: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.
verses.ct: "I am so insignificant — how could I possibly respond to you? I will cover my mouth with my hand.

verses.kjv: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.
verses.ct: I have spoken once, and I won't reply again. I spoke a second time, but I will say nothing more."

verses.kjv: Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
verses.ct: Then the LORD answered Job from the whirlwind and said,

verses.kjv: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
verses.ct: "Prepare yourself like a man. I will question you, and you will answer me.

verses.kjv: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?
verses.ct: Are you really going to overturn my justice? Will you declare me wrong so that you can be right?

verses.kjv: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
verses.ct: Do you have an arm as powerful as God's? Can your voice thunder the way his does?

verses.kjv: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.
verses.ct: Go ahead — dress yourself in majesty and splendor; clothe yourself in glory and beauty.

verses.kjv: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.
verses.ct: Unleash the full force of your anger, and look at everyone who is proud and humble them.

verses.kjv: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.
verses.ct: Look at everyone who is proud and bring them low; crush the wicked where they stand.

verses.kjv: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.
verses.ct: Bury them all in the dust together; imprison them in the realm of darkness.

verses.kjv: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.
verses.ct: Then even I will acknowledge to you that your own right hand can save you.

verses.kjv: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.
verses.ct: Now consider the behemoth, which I created alongside you. It eats grass like a cow.

verses.kjv: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.
verses.ct: Look at the power in its hips and the strength in the muscles of its belly.

verses.kjv: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.
verses.ct: It swings its tail like a cedar tree; the tendons of its thighs are tightly woven together.

verses.kjv: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.
verses.ct: Its bones are as strong as tubes of bronze; its limbs are like bars of iron.

verses.kjv: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.
verses.ct: It ranks first among God's works; only its Creator can approach it with a sword.

verses.kjv: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.
verses.ct: The mountains produce food for it, where all the wild animals play nearby.

verses.kjv: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
verses.ct: It lies beneath the lotus plants, hidden among the reeds and marshes.

verses.kjv: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.
verses.ct: The lotus plants shade it with their cover; the willows along the stream surround it.

verses.kjv: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.
verses.ct: When the river rages, it is not alarmed. It remains calm even if the Jordan surges against its mouth.

verses.kjv: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
verses.ct: Can anyone capture it while it is watching? Can anyone pierce its nose with a trap?"
